alert.note: Alert for Effingham; Screven (Georgia) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Charleston (the Southern end of South Carolina and Eastern Georgia)
info.headline: Flood Advisory issued August 25 at 8:09PM EDT by NWS Charleston
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 1115 PM EDT THIS EVENING... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected. * WHERE...Portions of southeast Georgia and southeast South Carolina, including the following counties, in southeast Georgia, Effingham and Screven. In southeast South Carolina, Hampton and Jasper. * WHEN...Until 1115 PM EDT. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 806 PM EDT, Doppler radar indicated heavy rain due to thunderstorms. Minor flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly in the advisory area. - Radar rainfall estimates range from 1 to 2 inches of rain so far. Hourly rainfall rates are likely in the 2 to 3 inch range. Additional rainfall amounts of 2 to 4 inches will be possible through the late evening hours. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Newington, Furman, Oliver, Scotia, Garnett, Clyo, Shirley, Robertville, Shawnee, Kildare, Pineland, Tarboro, Egypt, Tuckasee King, Brighton, Cosby, Oaky, Ardmore, De Loach and Stafford.
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Report flooding directly to the Charleston National Weather Service at 1-888-383-2024 or email your reports to nws.charlestonsc@noaa.gov.
